    • Method Detail

      • nBitByteArray

        public static byte[] nBitByteArray(int bits)
        Make a byte array just large enough to hold a specified number of bits.
        Parameters:
        bits - Amount of bits needed.
        Returns:
        New byte array initialized to all zeroes, big enough to hold the needed bits.

      • nBitByteArray

        public static byte[] nBitByteArray(int bits,
                                   int bitsPerByte)
        Make a byte array just large enough to hold a specified number of bits, only using some of the bits in each byte.
        Parameters:
        bits - How many bits to store.
        bitsPerByte - How many bits to put in each byte.
        Returns:
        New byte array initialized to all zeroes, big enough to hold the needed bits.

      • getBitByOffset

        public static byte getBitByOffset(int offset,
                                  byte[] data)
        Get the nth bit from a byte array starting from the left.
        Parameters:
        offset - Index of the desired bit (0-based).
        data - The byte array containing the bit.
        Returns:
        Byte with the rightmost bit being the desired bit and the rest being zero bits.

      • insertBit

        public static void insertBit(byte bit,
                             int bitIndex,
                             byte[] array)
        Insert a single bit into a specified 0-based index from the left.
        Parameters:
        bit - Byte representing the bit to insert. 1 or 0.
        bitIndex - How many bits from the left should the bit be inserted (0-based).
        array - Array to insert the bit in.

      • permuteBits

        public static byte[] permuteBits(byte[] data,
                                 int[] permTable)
        Function for modifying byte arrays at bit level.
        Parameters:
        data - Byte array to be modified. Length in bits must be greater than the largest number in permTable.
        permTable - Array of integers that specifies which bits go where in the new byte array. Each bit-index i in the new byte array will have permTable[i] as its value.
        Returns:
        New byte array with enough bytes to hold permTable.length bits, with n-th bit from the left being the m-th bit in the original byte array, where m = permTable[n].

      • rotateLeft

        public static byte[] rotateLeft(int rotN,
                                int lengthInBits,
                                byte[] data)
        Rotate a byte array bitwise to the left.
        Parameters:
        rotN - How many positions to rotate.
        lengthInBits - How many bits from the left to be considered as part of the array.
        data - Byte array to rotate.
        Returns:
        Bitwise-rotated byte array.

      • concatBits

        public static byte[] concatBits(byte[] left,
                                byte[] right,
                                int nBitsLeft,
                                int nBitsRight)
        Concatenates two byte arrays bitwise.
        Parameters:
        left - Array whose bits to put left in the concatenation.
        right - Array whose bits to put right in the concatenation.
        nBitsLeft - Number of bits in the left array.
        nBitsRight - Number of bits in the right array.
        Returns:
        Byte array with nBitsLeft bits from the left array starting from the left and nBitsRight bits from the right array after them.

      • copyBits

        public static byte[] copyBits(int startInclusive,
                              int endExclusive,
                              byte[] data)
        Copy a range of bits from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        startInclusive - Starting bit index, inclusive.
        endExclusive - Ending bit index, exclusive.
        data - Byte array to be copied from.
        Returns:
        New byte array with the copied range starting from the left.

      • bitwiseXOR

        public static byte[] bitwiseXOR(byte[] arr1,
                                byte[] arr2)
        Bitwise exclusive-or operation for two byte arrays.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - First operand.
        arr2 - Second operand.
        Returns:
        Byte array constructed by XORing the bits of arr1 and arr2.

      • inPlaceBitwiseXOR

        public static void inPlaceBitwiseXOR(byte[] arr1,
                                     byte[] arr2)
        In-place bitwise exclusive-or operation for two byte arrays. The result is stored in arr1.
        Parameters:
        arr1 - First operand. Will be overwritten.
        arr2 - Second operand.

      • chBitsPerByte

        public static byte[] chBitsPerByte(byte[] source,
                                   int currentBitCount,
                                   int targetBitCount)
        Stretch or compress a byte array by using a specified amount of bits in each byte. Bit count n means n low-order bits.
        Parameters:
        source - Array to be stretched/compressed.
        currentBitCount - How many bits are currently used per byte (low-order bits).
        targetBitCount - How many bits to put in each byte (low-order bits).
        Returns:
        Stretched/compressed byte array.
